column1: The purpose of the training process in a neural network is to fine-tune the edge weights to improve the accuracy of the model by repeating the combination of forward and backward error propagation .
column2: If you were tasked with training a new deep learning model, how would you utilize the process of forward propagation in conjunction to backward propagation?
column3: How would you utilize the backward error propagation step to refine the weights of the edges of a neural network?
column4: Given a pre-compiled model, how should you apply the loss function, optimizer, and learning rate during training?
column5: How can you use the calculated loss value to implement the necessary updates to the network’s weights during the supervised learning task?
column6: How would you utilize the backward error propagation step to refine the weights of the edges of a neural network?

column1: The learning rate of a hyper parameter initialized prior to training that dictates the magnitude of the number added to the current weight of an edge. If the learning rate is too small, training time can increase significantly
column2: How should you adjust the learning rate hyperparameter to potentially decrease the overall training time of a model that is converging very slowly?
column3: If a training model is continually overshooting the optimal point, how would you apply an adjustment to the learning rate to mitigate this issue?
column4: How can you utilize the learning rate value to control the speed and stability of a model’s convergence path?
column5: How would you apply the anal;ogy of an airplane decreasing speed when approaching an airport to explain the required use of the learning rate?
column6: How should you adjust the learning rate hyperparameter to potentially decrease the overall training time of a model that is converging very slowly?

column1: Although MPLs were used for image recognition, they are not scalable for computer vision tasks because every pair of adjacent layers is fully connected, whereas Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) are well suited for such tasks.
column2: How would you apply the structural advantage of a CNN architecture to solve the challenge of classifying large images efficiently?
column3: Given a large image dataset, how would you implement a CNN to utilize its ability for translation invariance during recognition?
column4: If you are building a model for image classification, how can you use the later types of a CNN instead of the fully connected layers of an MPL?
column5: How should you utilize a CNN to recognize an image regardless of its position within a bitmap, applying the concept of translation invariance?
column6: How would you apply the structural advantage of a CNN architecture to solve the challenge of classifying large images efficiently?

column1: When selecting a transfer function for an ANN, it is better to use a function that is continuous and differentiable to allow for network training.
column2: How would you apply the Sigmoid function to convert any input value into a probability range of 0 to1 for a binary classification task?
column3: How should you use the hyperbolic tangent function to achieve greater stability and minimize the vanishing gradient problem compared to a smoothened step function?
column4: How would you apply the Rectified Linear Unit activation function to increase sparsity and allow big numbers to pass through the neural network?
column5: Given a continuous function, how would you demonstrate that it is also a differential function by showing that a derivative exists at every point in the domain?
column6: How should you use the hyperbolic tangent function to achieve greater stability and minimize the vanishing gradient problem compared to a smoothened step function?

column1: A deep learning model is being trained to solve a multi-class classification problem where the model must discriminate between more than ten categories, and the output needs to be structured so that the output values represent a valid probability distribution
column2: How would you use cross-entropy as a loss function to compute the distance between the outputs and the ground truth labels to minimize the overall error?
column3: In a binary classification problem, how would you try to apply the Euclidean Distance Computation between the network output and the one-hot encoding for the purpose of optimization?
column4: How should you apply the softmax activation function to force the Neural Network’s outputs to sum to 1, thus converting the outputs into probabilities?
column5: If you have 1,000 target classes, how would you apply one-hot encoding to convert the string labels into a vector representation for the target variables?
column6: How should you apply the softmax activation function to force the Neural Network’s outputs to sum to 1, thus converting the outputs into probabilities?

column1: In TensorFlow, computation is defined through a graph structure, but the numerical operations within that graph are not executed until the graph is explicitly run within a dedicated environment, requiring a definition of the variables that will feed data into the computational graph
column2: How should you utilize the tf.Session() command in TensorFlow to initialize the computational graph and define the execution environment?
column3: If you are defining input data variables that are not loaded when assigned, how would you use a placeholder to take values when the session is executed with a feed dictionary?
column4: How would you use TensorBoard to visualize the computation graphs, device placements, and tensor details after defining names for the operations and placeholders?
column5: How would you apply the TensorFlow architecture to define an addition operation between two variables without immediately executing the computation?
column6: If you are defining input data variables that are not loaded when assigned, how would you use a placeholder to take values when the session is executed with a feed dictionary?

column1: The challenge posed by Data Variety, which includes dealing with both structured and unstructured data, necessitated the development of non-relational database technologies, such as NoSQL, for efficient storage and management in a Big Data context
column2: How would you apply the concept of Data Variety to justify migrating from a traditional relational database system to a non-relational one like NoSQL?
column3: How would you implement a key-value pair database to store data when the primary requirement is simplicity, often storing data mostly as strings?
column4: How would you execute the storage and retrieval of complex, heterogeneous, and unstructured content using non-relational technologies?
column5: If you were tasked with building a knowledge base for a genomic study, how would you apply the findings to identify genetic variations that explain disease susceptibility?
column6: How would you execute the storage and retrieval of complex, heterogeneous, and unstructured content using non-relational technologies?

column1: Graph databases, which are one of the non-relational database technologies developed for Big Data, use a model based on node relationships to efficiently deal with the management of highly interconnected data
column2: How would you execute a database structure that relies on node relationships to deal specifically with the management of highly interconnected data?
column3: If you needed to track genetic variations (SNPs) in a large-scale genome-wide association study (GWAS), how would you apply new biostatistical methods for quality control and analysis?
column4: How would you utilize a columnar database structure to optimize flexibility and scalability when managing massive data volume and variety?
column5: When analyzing social networks with billions of shared content pieces, how would you implement a machine learning algorithm designed specifically for parallel processing environments like Hadoop MapReduce?
column6: How would you execute a database structure that relies on node relationships to deal specifically with the management of highly interconnected data?

column1: Modern datasets include complex forms of data such as video, audio, text, and images, which are heterogeneous and must be carefully structured before machine analysis algorithms can successfully process them
column2: How would a data scientist utilize specific preprocessing techniques to transform semistructured XML logs into a homogenous format for classification analysis?
column3: How can we define the concept of data variety in the context of the 3Vs model?
column4: If you encounter a large volume of medical records containing text, graphics, and images, how would you apply structuring methods to make this data consumable by a machine learning algorithm?
column5: How would you list the different types of data sources, such as databases, text, and connected objects?
column6: If you encounter a large volume of medical records containing text, graphics, and images, how would you apply structuring methods to make this data consumable by a machine learning algorithm?

column1: Advanced analytics, which includes predictive analytics and artificial intelligence, is critical because it can be correctly aligned with business processes and needs to lead to significant improvement in organizational performance and decision quality
column2: How would a company employ predictive modeling on historical transactional data to optimize inventory levels and increase business value?
column3: How do Big Data's characteristics (the 3Vs) challenge traditional computational tools?
column4: How should we describe the relationship between big data analysis and enhanced insight into business operations?
column5: If a social network company (like Facebook) needed to improve its user engagement decisions, how would it apply data mining techniques to the streams of social data it collects daily?
column6: How would a company employ predictive modeling on historical transactional data to optimize inventory levels and increase business value?
